abstract_summ: There is rising concern about the mental health challenges of the general population, COVID-19-infected patients, close contacts, elderly, children and health professionals.We outlined major challenges for patients with psychiatric disorders and mental health professionals during the COVID-19 outbreak, and also discussed how to manage these challenges through further mental health service reform in China.• Through this correspondence, I aim to highlight the eminent need of psychological crisis intervention in the wake of ongoing novel coronavirus outbreak that took place in China and has transmitted throughout the world.(PsycInfo Database Record (c) 2020 APA, all rights reserved).During the COVID-19 outbreak, the mental health of health care workers has become a major public health concern.This recommendation can inform how other countries can overcome mental health challenges during this pandemic.The effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on population mental health are unknown.
